security_audit.summary: This is an official skill with templated HTML and JavaScript assets. No elevated permissions or executable payloads are present in the scanned files.

content.user_title: Create algorithmic art with seeded p5.js
content.value_statement: You want original generative art with a clear process and reproducible outputs. This skill guides a philosophy and provides templates for interactive p5.js art.
actual_capabilities: Provides a p5.js viewer HTML template with a branded layout and sidebar controls
Includes seed input with previous, next, and random actions for deterministic regeneration
Defines parameter sliders and color pickers wired to update handlers
Supplies a generator JavaScript template with a parameter object and seed initialization
Offers utility functions for color parsing, mapping, easing, and wrapping
limitations: Does not ship a finished art algorithm, placeholders must be implemented
Requires browser access to external CDNs for p5.js and Google Fonts
No built in export or image saving workflow is included
Limited to p5.js canvas sketches and UI controls in the template

use_cases.title: Build a new art sketch
use_cases.description: Turn a custom philosophy into a reproducible p5.js artwork with adjustable parameters.

use_cases.title: Teach generative principles
use_cases.description: Use the templates to demonstrate seeded randomness and parameterized systems.

use_cases.title: Prototype interactive art
use_cases.description: Create a branded viewer to explore generative variations with simple controls.

prompt_templates.title: Beginner concept
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a short algorithmic philosophy for calm flow fields and list three parameters to control density, speed, and color.

prompt_templates.title: Basic viewer setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Draft a plan to fill the viewer template with a particle flow system and explain how each UI control maps to a parameter.

prompt_templates.title: Detailed algorithm
prompt_templates.prompt: Design a seeded particle system with a noise based flow field and describe the update and render steps in clear terms.

prompt_templates.title: Advanced variation
prompt_templates.prompt: Embed a subtle concept of tidal rhythms into the algorithm and propose parameter ranges that reveal the theme without literal shapes.

output_examples.input: Create a generative flow field that feels like wind through reeds
output: Movement uses layered noise for gentle directional shifts
Particle density increases near the lower edge for grounded weight
Colors blend from muted green to warm tan over time

best_practices: Use seeded randomness for reproducibility and consistent regeneration
Tie every UI control to a clear system property and update strategy
Keep the philosophy focused so the algorithm has room for craft
anti_patterns: Copying existing artists work or recognizable styles
Ignoring the template structure and rebuilding the UI from scratch
Using unseeded random calls that break deterministic outputs

faq.question: Is this compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes, it is plain text guidance and templates that work across those tools.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides templates and guidance, but you must implement the final algorithm.

faq.question: Can I integrate it into my web app?
faq.answer: Yes, you can embed the HTML and JS templates in your app and customize controls.

faq.question: Does it handle data safety or storage?
faq.answer: No, it does not store data or send data to external services.

faq.question: What if the sketch does not render?
faq.answer: Check the browser console, confirm p5.js loads, and verify parameter handlers are implemented.

faq.question: How does it compare to a full art engine?
faq.answer: It is a lightweight template and philosophy guide, not a full generative framework.
